abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            substantial, accomplished though satisfactory performances
            by both the Bank and Borrower. Lessons learned are organized
            into five distinct categories: (a) key aspects of project
            design reinforce the importance of monitoring and
            evaluation, of clear and focused project objectives, and, of
            strong government ownership; (b) the implementation of
            policy in a decentralized setting, gave each program unit at
            the central, provincial, and district levels, experience of
            their new role under decentralization, namely, in designing
            and implementing iodine deficiency disorder (IDD) control
            programs, and, through the grant system, participating
            governments gained considerable knowledge, and experience in
            project proposal preparation, implementation, and monitoring
            and evaluation, which through the establishment of a
            Technical Review Team, district authorities are expected to
            review their own proposals; (c) the design of effective
            social enforcement, developed as an alternative to increase
            compliance with iodized salt regulations, in the absence of
            an effective legal environment, was conducive to successful
            social enforcement strategies, disseminated and implemented
            across provinces; (d) innovations in the productive capacity
            of iodized salt, through salt production from Demplots have
            been exhibited in certain districts, and also increased the
            daily income of the salt farmers, a success reflected in the
            observation that some districts are considering to replicate
            Demplots with their own local budget. However, replication
            to other locations need attention, and support from local
            governments. Focusing on centers of salt production, it is
            suggested the critical point of enforcement is during salt
            harvest season, when small producers dramatically increase
            the stocks of un-iodized salt in the country; and, (e) the
            determination of appropriate IDD indicators, shows that the
            Total Goiter Rate (TGR) assessed through palpation as an
            indicator of the current iodine status of the community is
            low due to cross-assessor variation, and should no longer be
            recommended. The International Commission for Control of IDD
            (ICCIDD) now recommends the use of urinary iodine excretion
            (UIE), as well as the proportion of households consuming
            iodized salt, as indicators to assess progress towards
            elimination of IDD.
